message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.SI 

This paper is about response selection in retrieval-based chatbots, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). The paper proposes a new matching framework for multi-turn conversation, which involves modeling the relationships among utterances in the context. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which focuses on NLP and related tasks. The paper also uses deep learning techniques, such as recurrent neural networks (RNNs), which are commonly used in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). The task of response selection can also be seen as a form of information retrieval (IR), which is covered in cs.IR. Finally, the paper proposes a new matching framework that can capture the important information in contexts, which can be seen as a form of feature engineering or representation learning, which is covered in cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
